lines.gurmukhi: crn kml rj gurisK mwQY lwgI bwCq skl gurisK pg ryn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Raj Gursikh Maadai Laagee , Baachhat Sakal Gursikh Pag Rayn Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru who is blessed by the holy dust of the feet of the True Guru (who receives the boon of Naam Simran from the True Guru), the entire Universe crave for the dust of his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin koit kmlw klpqr pwrs AMmiRq icMqwmin kwmDyn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kotani Kotaani Koti Kamalaa Kalapatara , Paaras Anmrit Chintaamani Kaamadhayn Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of goddesses of wealth, tree of Indra's heavenly garden (Kalap- Variksh), philosopher stones, elixirs, distress removing forces and heavenly cows (Kamdhenu) desire the touch of such a Sikh of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: suir nr nwQ muin qiRBvn Aau qiRkwl log byd igAwn aunmwn jyn kyn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Suri Nar Naad Mouni Tribhavan Au Trikaala , Log Bayd Giaan Ounamaan Jayn Kayn Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of gods, humans, sages, master yogis, all the three worlds, the three times, wondrous knowledge of Vedas and many such estimates beg for the holy dust of the feet of such a disciple of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin isK sMgiq AsMK jw kY nmo nmo gurmuK suKPl dyn hY ]193]
lines.transliteration_english: Kotani Kotaani Sikh Sangati Asankh Jaa Kai , Namo Namo Gurmoukh Soukhaphal Dayn Hai ?193?

Shabad OS B.translation: There are numerous congregations of such Sikhs of the True Guru. I bow again and again before such True Guru who is the blesser of such elixir-like Naam that provides comfort and peace. (193)
